title: ‚ÄòIf only they fought like Rani of Jhansi‚Äô: BJP MP blames women for Pahalgam death toll
content: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ram Chander Jangra sparked controversy by suggesting women killed in the Pahalgam terror attack lacked bravery. He claimed that if they had training or fought back, casualties would have been lower. Jangra referenced PM Modi's Agniveer initiative and historical figures like Rani of Jhansi, drawing criticism.

title: Delhi storm disrupts air travel: 49 flights diverted, several delayed
content: Delhi experienced a severe thunderstorm overnight, with heavy rain and strong winds reaching 82 kmph. The intense weather caused significant disruptions, including the diversion of 49 flights at Indira Gandhi International Airport and widespread waterlogging on key roads like Moti Bagh and Minto Road. Flight operations have resumed, but delays persist, and traffic congestion remains a challenge in several areas.

title: '2015 was Pak's last chance': Tharoor recalls Pathankot betrayal after PM's Lahore visit
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading an all-party delegation in the US, highlighted India's past peace efforts towards Pakistan, which were followed by terror attacks like Pathankot in 2016. Tharoor emphasized that after years of failed attempts at diplomacy, India has adopted a new approach with Operation Sindoor, conducting precise strikes against terror infrastructure.

title: UP sub-inspector dies while sleeping as ACP office roof collapses during heavy rains
content: In Ghaziabad, a 58-year-old sub-inspector, Veerendra Mishra, tragically died when the roof of the Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACP) office in Ankur Vihar collapsed during severe storms and heavy rainfall. Mishra, who was working late, was fatally injured when the building, previously a police chowki, gave way around 2 am. Authorities have initiated an investigation into the incident.

title: Operation Sindoor face of changing India: PM Modi in Mann Ki Baat - Key highlights
content: Prime Minister Modi, in Mann Ki Baat, lauded Operation Sindoor's success and the surge in patriotism, highlighting its impact beyond military action. He also celebrated the growth of Asiatic lions in Gir, development in Maoist-affected areas, and women's empowerment through technology. The address further showcased the North East's talent, Gujarat's women forest officers, and inspiring individuals like Jeevan Joshi.

title: Google founder Sergey Brin on going back to work after retirement: There's just never been a ...
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: Too soon or perfect timing? Experts weigh in on Shubman Gill's elevation
content: Shubman Gill's appointment as Test captain, though surprising to some, was a carefully considered decision by Indian selectors, dating back to the T20 World Cup. His captaincy in the Zimbabwe T20Is and leadership in the Gujarat Titans solidified his potential.

title: Nine of a doc's 10 kids killed in Israel airstrike
content: Gaza's health ministry reports 79 deaths in the last 24 hours due to Israeli strikes, with hospitals in the north inaccessible. Among the casualties were nine children of a pediatrician, Alaa Najjar, killed in Khan Younis; her husband was severely wounded, and their only surviving child is in critical condition.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO's speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: EC announces bypolls to 5 assembly seats in 4 states on June 19; counting on June 23
content: The Election Commission has announced by-elections for five assembly seats. These seats are spread across Gujarat, Kerala, Punjab, and West Bengal. Polling is scheduled for June 19. The counting of votes will occur on June 23. Gujarat will have bypolls in Kadi and Visavadar.

title: Trump admin challenges court ruling on deportation flights to South Sudan
content: The Trump administration is challenging a judge's ruling that halted a deportation flight to South Sudan. Secretary of State Rubio claims the order complicates diplomacy with Libya, South Sudan, and Djibouti, potentially undermining presidential authority. The administration argues it detains dangerous criminals and urges reconsideration, asserting the deportees had due process before removal.

title: One blow after another for Reds: Chief of banned CPI-maoist splinter bloc gunned down
content: Pappu Lohra, head of the Maoist splinter group Jharkhand Jan Mukti Parishad (JJMP), and his second-in-command were killed in a gunfight with police in Latehar district. This elimination is part of an intensified crackdown on Maoists and breakaway factions in Jharkhand.

title: Who is Vaniya Agrawal, the software engineer who disrupted Microsoft‚Äôs events
content: Vaniya Agrawal, an Indian-American software engineer, protested Microsoft's ties with the Israeli government. She disrupted two major Microsoft events. Agrawal questioned the company's cloud contracts. She was later fired by Microsoft after the first protest. Agrawal previously worked at Amazon. She also ran a small business. She is now sharing videos of her protests on social media.

title: Duo cut off dead tigress‚Äôs claws to get a grip over ‚Äòdisobedient‚Äô wives in MP
content: A tigress was found dead in Madhya Pradesh. The carcass was mutilated. Claws and canines were chopped off. Police arrested five suspects. Two confessed they sought a charm. The charm was to control their wives. They followed a sorcerer's advice. Tiger claws held the secret to marital dominance. The suspects are in custody. Investigators are looking for the sorcerer.

title: IPL deal would've led to India debut for Easwaran long back: Father
content: Abhimanyu Easwaran, a consistent domestic performer, has been named in India's squad for the upcoming Test series against England, marking another opportunity to finally make his debut. Despite past near-misses and selectors favouring other players, Easwaran remains determined, preparing rigorously for English conditions with specialised training and unwavering focus.

title: MP minister Vijay Shah ‚Äòmissing‚Äô, claims Congress; offers Rs 11,000 reward for info
content: Congress workers in Indore have posted 'missing' posters of state minister Vijay Shah, offering a reward for information on his whereabouts. This action follows Shah's controversial remarks against Col Sofiya Qureshi. The Congress alleges Shah has gone 'underground' and criticizes his absence from a recent cabinet meeting.

title: 'Such mistakes are unacceptable': Preity Zinta slams third umpire
content: Punjab Kings co-owner Preity Zinta has strongly criticised a third umpire's controversial decision during their IPL 2025 loss to Delhi Capitals. The incident involved a potential six by Shashank Singh, which was controversially ruled a single. Zinta expressed her frustration on social media, stating such errors are unacceptable with the available technology.

title: Record surge in US applications for UK residency
content: The UK Home Office reported a record high of 6,618 US citizens applying for British nationality or indefinite residency in the year leading up to March, the highest since 2004. A surge occurred at the start of 2025, coinciding with Donald Trump's second term, despite the Labour government's efforts to reduce immigration.

title: Paresh Rawal responds to ‚ÄòHera Pheri 3‚Äô controversy: ‚ÄòAll issues will be laid to rest‚Äô
content: Paresh Rawal's departure from 'Hera Pheri 3' has sparked a legal battle, with Akshay Kumar's team alleging disruptions and financial losses due to Rawal's exit. Rawal confirmed his lawyer has responded to his termination, assuring that the disputes will be resolved once his response is reviewed. The controversy casts a shadow over the highly anticipated third installment.

title: 'Went missing for 20 seconds': US Army on Black Hawk which lost contact near Pentagon
content: A US Army helicopter briefly lost contact with air traffic controllers near the Pentagon. This incident forced two commercial jets to abort their landings at a Washington airport. The communication loss occurred due to a misplaced antenna. The Army has paused Pentagon flights to address safety concerns. This follows previous close calls and a deadly mid-air collision earlier this year.

title: Rosie O‚ÄôDonnell reveals dramatic weight loss after using Mounjaro; How safe is it?
content: Rosie O'Donnell reveals her weight loss journey. She attributes her transformation to Mounjaro. O'Donnell also mentions lifestyle changes. These include diet and exercise. She now lives in Ireland with her child. She has struggled with weight for years. Mounjaro is used for diabetes and weight management. Several celebrities have used it. Doctors consider it safe for older adults.

title: Pakistan ‚Äòvile handler of rabid dogs‚Äô: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee in Japan
content: Abhishek Banerjee, a Trinamool leader, spoke in Japan about terrorism. He called Pakistan a handler of terrorists. Banerjee is part of a delegation taking India's anti-terrorism message abroad. He urged the Indian diaspora to advocate for India's stance. Banerjee highlighted evidence linking Pakistan to terrorist groups. He emphasized India's firm resolve against terrorism following the Pahalgam attack.

title: 'Credit for Shubman Gill's success goes to his father and Yuvraj Singh'
content: Yograj Singh attributes Shubman Gill's success as India's new Test captain to the strong foundation laid by his father and the crucial mentorship of Yuvraj Singh. Yograj emphasised Yuvraj's profound cricketing wisdom and guidance, which has significantly shaped Gill's development and leadership potential.

title: Asteroid with power of 1000 nuclear bombs is moving towards Earth
content: A large asteroid, 2003 MH4, is set to approach Earth on May 24, 2025, at a distance of 6.68 million kilometers. Classified as a Potentially Hazardous Asteroid due to its size and proximity, it's being closely monitored by NASA. While a collision is unlikely, its Earth-crossing orbit highlights the importance of planetary defense efforts. Read below to know more!

title: After roadshow over bail in Karnataka, all gang-rape accused land back in jail
content: In Haveri, police arrested three more suspects involved in a celebratory roadshow after their bail in a gang rape case. This brings the total arrests to seven. The suspects were presented before the magistrate and sent to judicial custody until June 2. Police confiscated vehicles used in the procession. The accused violated bail conditions by conducting the procession with supporters.

title: 'Death threats': How a doorstep grocery delivery ended with fractured skull
content: In Bengaluru's Judges Colony, businessman Shashank S. alleges assault by Zepto delivery executive Vishnuvardhan over an address dispute. The altercation escalated after Shashank questioned Vishnuvardhan's rudeness towards his sister-in-law. Shashank claims Vishnuvardhan hurled abuses, punched him, and issued a death threat. Suffering a skull fracture, Shashank posted on Instagram seeking justice.

title: Vivek Dahiya reveals battling alcohol addiction during lockdown
content: Television actor Vivek Dahiya recently revealed his struggle with alcohol addiction during the lockdown. Dahiya, known for his roles in popular TV shows, shared that the disrupted routine led to increased alcohol consumption. Realizing the negative impact on his lifestyle and well-being, he sought therapy.

title: Groom kidnapped from mandap by dancers at wedding in Bihar
content: A wedding celebration in Gopalganj descended into chaos when a dispute between wedding guests and hired dancers escalated into violence. The groom, Sonu Kumar Sharma, was abducted from his own wedding mandap following a clash over the dance troupe's performance. After a nine-hour ordeal, police rescued Sharma from Siwan district, revealing the abduction stemmed from a payment disagreement.

title: Big boost for RCB: Star pacer returns ahead of IPL 2025 playoffs
content: Josh Hazlewood has rejoined Royal Challengers Bengaluru ahead of the crucial IPL 2025 playoffs, boosting the team's chances of winning their first title. After uncertainty surrounding his availability due to the World Test Championship final and a shoulder niggle, Hazlewood arrived in Lucknow on Sunday. His return strengthens RCB's pace attack for the knockout stage.

title: Heavy rain lashes Delhi-NCR; strong winds cause disruption
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Saturday issued a red alert for Delhi and nearby areas, warning of strong thunderstorms, rain, and high-speed winds over the next two to three hours. The alert is part of a Nowcast warning based on the current weather conditions.

title: IPL top-two qualification scenarios: GT, PBKS, RCB, MI set for final sprint
content: Mumbai Indians secured the final Indian Premier League 2025 playoff berth, joining Gujarat Titans, Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings. These top four teams now battle for a crucial top-two finish, guaranteeing two shots at the final. Unexpectedly, GT, RCB and PBKS stumbled in their recent matches, intensifying the competition.

title: Rehab home staff beat TN youth with ADHD to death
content: In Coimbatore, police exhumed the body of Varunkanth, a 24-year-old with ADHD, revealing he was beaten to death at a rehabilitation center near Pollachi. Four individuals have been arrested, while trustees Shaji and Dr. Kavitha are on the run. The staff fabricated a story about Varunkanth's disappearance at Aliyar dam after his murder on May 12.

title: Married by morning, missing by noon: How ‚ÄòDaku Dulhan‚Äô finally ran out of road
content: Gulshana, known as 'Daku Dulhan,' orchestrated marriage scams across multiple states, assuming different identities to deceive grooms and their families. She would finalize alliances through matrimonial sites, negotiate a 'settlement amount,' and then vanish with valuables after the wedding ceremony. Gulshana, along with her gang members, targeted families struggling to find suitable matches, exploiting their desperation for financial gain.

title: Afghanistan hit by 4.2 magnitude earthquake, fifth in nine days
content: Afghanistan has experienced a series of earthquakes, with a 4.2 magnitude tremor striking early Sunday, the fifth in just over a week. While assessments are ongoing, no immediate reports of injuries or damage have surfaced.

title: 'End terror justifications': Indian delegation's big message to Pak in Bahrain
content: An Indian parliamentary delegation, including AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi, engaged with Bahraini figures, denouncing the misuse of religion by terrorist groups and emphasising Islam's rejection of terrorism. Ghulam Nabi Azad sought international support against terrorism, urging Pakistan to dismantle its infrastructure. Phangnon Konyak highlighted Pakistan's continued terror activities since partition, requesting Bahrain's intervention.

title: Salman Khan attends Mumbai wedding with high security; Sohail Khan makes appearance
content: Salman Khan was spotted attending the nikah ceremony of Ayaz Khan and Zeba in the city, and the actor was seen entering the event under tight security. Videos and pictures of the Sikandar actor are going viral on the internet, as the security personnel struggled to control the crowd mobbing the actor upon his arrival at the wedding ceremony.

title: New era dawns at Roland Garros: No Nadal, slumping Swiatek & no favourites
content: With Rafael Nadal's retirement and Iga Swiatek's struggles, the French Open enters a period of uncertainty. Several contenders, including Carlos Alcaraz, Alexander Zverev, and Novak Djokovic, vie for the men's title. On the women's side, Swiatek faces challenges from Aryna Sabalenka, Coco Gauff, and emerging talents like Mirra Andreeva, making for an open and unpredictable tournament.

title: 'We‚Äôre a status quo power, Pakistan is not': Shashi Tharoor in US address - watch video
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading a multi-party delegation, addressed the Pahalgam terror attack in New York, condemning the religiously motivated killings and highlighting the Resistance Front's involvement, linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba. India responded with targeted strikes on terror sites, sending a clear message against terrorism. The delegation aims to foster international cooperation and share India's perspective on combating terrorism across multiple nations.

title: Guj ATS arrests health worker for sharing BSF, Navy info with Pak spy
content: Gujarat ATS apprehended Sahdevsinh Gohil, a contractual health worker from Kutch, for allegedly leaking sensitive information about BSF and Indian Navy establishments to a Pakistani spy. Gohil shared photos and videos via WhatsApp in exchange for money, after being contacted by the agent in June 2023. He also provided a SIM card registered with his Aadhaar to the agent.

title: Russia hits Ukraine with drones and missiles, authorities warn of 'new ones'
content: Ukraine faced a second night of Russian attacks involving ballistic missiles and drones, with air defenses intercepting many. Kyiv's military administration reported numerous drones entering the capital's airspace, urging residents to seek shelter. Amidst the ongoing conflict, a large prisoner exchange occurred between Russia and Ukraine, involving 307 soldiers on each side.

title: Earliest monsoon in Kerala in 16 years, hits Northeast same day
content: The southwest monsoon arrived in Kerala on Saturday, eight days ahead of schedule, marking an early start to India's rainy season. Simultaneously, the monsoon reached Mizoram, significantly ahead of its normal date. Favorable conditions suggest further advancement across Goa, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, and other northeastern states, potentially boosting early kharif sowing operations and aiming for record foodgrain output.

title: JKBOSE Class 11 result 2025 declared at jkbose.nic.in ‚Äì check scores now
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Board of School Education (JKBOSE) has declared the Class 11 result 2025 on May 24, 2025. Students can check their scores using their roll number and registration number at jkbose.nic.in or jkresults.nic.in. The result is provisional and final marksheets will be issued by schools. Exams were conducted in February‚ÄìMarch 2025. Students can apply for revaluation in August and begin preparing for Class 12 or competitive exams like JEE, NEET, and CUET.

title: Biden attends grandson's graduation in first public appearance since cancer diagnosis
content: Former President Joe Biden, recently diagnosed with prostate cancer, made a public appearance at his grandson Robert Hunter Biden II's high school graduation in Connecticut. The family, including Jill and Ashley Biden, celebrated the milestone.

title: Bring reforms to increase number of working women: PM at Niti meet
content: PM Modi, chairing the Niti Aayog meeting, advocated for greater inclusion of women in the workforce through policy changes and improved working conditions. He urged states to develop world-class tourist destinations and focus on health infrastructure.

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Wolves rebound, demolish Thunder in Game 3 rout
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Ant keys Wolves' emphatic response in rout of OKC
content: Behind Anthony Edwards' 30 points in three quarters, the Timberwolves responded to a 2-0 deficit in the Western Conference finals with a decisive 143-101 win over the Thunder in Game 3.

title: OKC 'punched in the mouth' as Wolves muscle up
content: The Thunder credited the Wolves' "physicality" Saturday night in a 143-101 Game 3 loss in which Oklahoma City never mounted a serious comeback bid.

title: Clark, Fever lament officiating late in loss to NY
content: The Liberty remained unbeaten Saturday with a 90-88 win over the Fever, who were not happy with the officiating over the final 10 seconds.

title: Up 3-0, Panthers will not 'start looking ahead'
content: The Florida Panthers, back home for the first time in more than a week, cruised past the Carolina Hurricanes 6-2 on Saturday, taking a 3-0 lead in the Eastern Conference finals and moving within one win of a third straight trip to the Stanley Cup Final.

title: Soto answers week of questions with key 2B in win
content: Juan Soto's first extra-base hit since May 9 -- a fourth-inning double at Citi Field -- gave the Mets the lead for good in an eventual 5-2 win over the Dodgers.

title: Sources: Knicks mull benching Hart for Robinson
content: With their starting five struggling, the Knicks are considering moving backup center Mitchell Robinson into the lineup for Josh Hart, sources told ESPN.

title: Judge (18 HRs) insists he's still 'work in progress'
content: Aaron Judge said he still doesn't feel "too great at the plate" yet this season despite hitting nearly .400 with 18 home runs so far this year.

title: Buffalo seals dynasty with historic NLL three-peat
content: The Bandits pulled away for a 15-6 victory in Saturday's decisive Game 3 and became just the second team in NLL history to win three consecutive championships.

title: üèà Vols-Bruins 'QB swap' leads portal superlatives
content: We awarded superlatives for a spring college football transfer portal window that saw Tennessee and UCLA swap quarterbacks, among other intriguing moves.

title: Panthers one game away from another Cup Final: Grades, biggest takeaways from Game 3
content: A dominant third period gave Florida a 6-2 and pushed Carolina to the brink. Here's what to watch in Game 4.

title: After 18-year wait, Arsenal are European champs again, ushering in thrilling new UWCL era
content: Arsenal are shock winners of the UEFA Women's Champions League, the first time the trophy went to a club other than Barcelona or Lyon in a decade.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: What does a lap of Monaco in a McLaren feel like? Restrained
content: Lapping the streets of Monaco, one is left with a common feeling within F1: This place is holding cars back.

title: Ancelotti bids emotional farewell to take place among Real Madrid greats
content: Even legends get fired at Real Madrid after a trophyless season, but Ancelotti leaves as the club's most successful coach, and a tough act to follow.

title: Picking the NFL‚Äôs most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Commanders hoping Deebo, Tunsil, draft picks will keep Jayden Daniels ascending
content: Washington believes veteran additions Samuel, Tunsil and draft picks at OT, WR will bring different dynamic to offense.

title: Is Betts poised to pass Trout as best player of their generation? Let's find out
content: Mookie Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Mike Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: Sources: De Bruyne heading toward Napoli move
content: Kevin De Bruyne will open talks with Napoli next week over a free agent move to the newly-crowned Serie A champions, rejecting the chance to move to MLS with Chicago Fire FC, sources have told ESPN.

title: Galaxy, San Diego condemn postgame fan brawl
content: The LA Galaxy and San Diego FC condemned the violence that broke out between supporters following the match at Snapdragon Stadium on Saturday afternoon, insisting the incident does not reflect the values of either club.

title: Sunderland's 95th-minute goal seals PL return
content: Sunderland staged a remarkable comeback to beat Sheffield United in the Championship playoff final and return to the Premier League after seven years.

title: Gotham wins inaugural Concacaf W Champions Cup
content: Spain international Esther Gonz√°lez scored a late goal as Gotham FC defeated the UANL Tigres 1-0 on Saturday to win the first edition of the CONCACAF W Champions Cup.

title: Miami shows 'soul,' 'fight' in Messi-inspired rally
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said his players showed soul and fight to come back from a 2-0 halftime deficit to draw 3-3 against the Philadelphia Union on Saturday night at Subaru Park.

title: AC Milan fans bash brass in 'Go Home' protest
content: AC Milan wrapped up their disappointing season with a 2-0 win over Monza on Saturday, but the game was overshadowed by fan protests against the club ownership and hierarchy both before and during the match.

title: Sources: Ansu in talks to leave Bar√ßa for Monaco
content: Barcelona forward Ansu Fati is in talks to join French side Monaco next season, various sources have confirmed to ESPN.

title: Congratulations, you've been promoted to the Premier League! Now what?
content: The past six teams to come up to the Premier League have gone straight back down. How can Leeds, Burnley and Sunderland break that cycle next season?

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Amorim. Let's make the arguments for keeping him and making a change.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gunners shift their sights towards Le√£o
content: Could AC Milan star Rafael Le√£o be headed to Arsenal this summer? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Best surprises, worst surprises and no surprises: Takeaways from Week 1 of the WNBA
content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: In 1st Mann Ki Baat Address After Operation Sindoor, PM Modi Shows Damaged Lashkar Camps
content: India launched Operation Sindoor and struck multiple terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir after an attack in Pahalgam left 26 people dead.

title: "Want To Know Who...": Donald Trump Attacks Harvard. Again
content: US President Donald Trump defended his administration's move to block Harvard University's ability to enrol international students after a judge suspended the action.

title: One Man, 67 Children, Deadly Gene: Rare Cancer Detected In 10 Children
content: The matter came to light after two families approached their fertility clinics upon discovering their children had cancer.

title: "Husband Asks, Why Don't You Die?": UP Woman Kills Self, Blames In-Laws
content: A 23-year-old woman who married four months ago died by suicide and recorded the act on her phone. In the video, the woman from Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad accused her husband, father-in-law and sister-in-law of pushing her to the edge.

title: India's Astronauts Vs Pakistan's Terrorists: A Tale of Two National Visions
content: While India trains scientists and astronauts to explore the cosmos, state-sponsored terror operates undeterred in Pakistan, Dr VK Saraswat, former DRDO chief said.

title: Two Teens Charred To Death In Fire At E-Rickshaw Charging Station In Delhi
content: According to a preliminary inquiry, the fire is suspected to have sparked from an electrical short circuit while charging.

title: "DRDO's Performance In Op Sindoor Was Stellar": Top Missile Scientist In NITI Aayog
content: Operation Sindoor was a true showcase of India's indigenous competencies developed by the Defence Research and Development Organisation's (DRDO) deep capabilities, said Dr V.K. Saraswat, a missile scientist and member (S&T), NITI Aayog.

title: "Price To Pay": Shashi Tharoor Says No One In Pakistan Can Kill Indians With Impunity
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said no one sitting in Pakistan is going to be allowed to believe that they can just walk across the border and kill Indian citizens with impunity, as he asserted that there will be a "price to pay."

title: "On Public Demand": 'Rosesh Sarabhai' Mocks Bilawal Bhutto's Speech
content: Joining the laughs online, actor Rajesh Kumar playfully mocked Pakistan's Bilawal Bhutto by imitating his speech with a classic 'Rosesh Sarabhai' flair.

title: Ex-Harvard Worker Stole Human Heads, Skin. Then Sold It In Black Market
content: Cedric Lodge admitted to transporting stolen human remains taken from cadavers donated to Harvard for medical research and education.

title: 'Women In Pahalgam Lacked Heroic Qualities': BJP MP's Shocker
content: On April 22, 25 tourists and a ponywallah were killed by five terrorists at the picturesque Baisaran meadow near Pahalgam.

title: India Becomes World's Fourth Largest Economy, Overtakes Japan: NITI Aayog CEO
content: Briefing reporters after the 10th Governing Council meeting of Niti Aayog, BVR Subrahmanyam said the overall geopolitical and economic environment is favourable to India.

title: NDTV Ground Report: Extortion Part Of China's Unconventional War On India
content: The NSCN-IM plans to raise over Rs 158 crore in what they call "sovereignty tax", under which everything from food items to fuel to construction materials is "taxed".

title: Flight Ops Hit, Trees Uprooted, Roads Flooded As Delhi Receives Heavy Rain
content: Streets were waterlogged and flights were delayed as Delhi and surrounding areas witnessed heavy rains, thunderstorms and strong winds overnight.

title: North Korea Detains 3 Officials Over Accident During Warship Launch
content: The failed launch that crippled the 5,000-tonne warship was witnessed by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un who said the accident damaged the country's dignity.

title: Shashi Tharoor's "Don't Work For Government" Reply To Pahalgam Question
content: In the US, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor gave a call for the world to come together to fight unitedly against terrorism.

title: "Back To Spending 24/7 At Work": Elon Musk After Brief X Outage
content: After the X outage on Saturday, Elon Musk suggested that he may have been away from his companies for too long.

title: "From Jawaharlal Nehru To PM Modi...": Kanimozhi-Led MPs Slam Pak In Russia
content: A delegation led by DMK MP Kanimozhi Karunanidhi was in Russia to sensitise the diplomatic leadership about terror emanating from Pakistan.

title: Remove Policy Bottlenecks, Increase Development Speed: PM To Chief Ministers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said that global investors are hugely interested in India and the states should utilise this opportunity to attract investments by removing policy bottlenecks.

title: Red Alert For Rain, Storm Issued For Delhi And Nearby Areas
content: A red alert for rain and storm has been issued for Delhi and the National Capital Region by the weather office, warning of squally winds of 60-100 kmph between 10.30 pm and 12.30 am.

title: Internet divided over 'Made-in-India' manhole cover in Seattle
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Experts weigh in: How will Djokovic and Swiatek fare? Can Alcaraz defend?
content: Carlos Alcaraz is the no. 2 seed in the french open . he says his confidence is high ahead of the Paris major . will Jannik Sinner win the title as he returns from a doping ban?

title: De Bruyne, San√©, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .

title: Mets, Dodgers prepare for high-stakes NL matchup
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .

title: What's at stake on the final weekend: Titles, cup finals, UCL, relegation
content: the 2024-25 season has entered the closing stages . the battles for the major honours, european qualification, relegation and promotion reached their conclusion . here's a roundup of what's at stake and what could be decided in the english premier league , german Bundesliga , Spanish LaLiga , Italian Serie A and French Ligue 1 .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: conference commissioners voted to go to a straight seeding format in 2025 . there are plenty of things to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond . the 2025 season starting in less than 100 days, we at least know how things take shape this fall .

title: Sources: Ten Hag may replace Alonso at Bayer
content: The Leverkusen crowd salutes Xabi Alonso in his last home match before departing at the end of the season. (1:35) Erik ten Hag is closing in on a return to management with  Bayer Leverkusen , sources have told ESPN. Ten Hag and his representatives have held constructive talks with the  Bundesliga  side and there is hope on both sides that an agreement can be reached. The Dutchman has been without a club since leaving  Manchester United  in November. Sources have told ESPN that he is reluctant to return to former club Ajax, where there is also a vacancy, and that his preference is to take over at Bayer Leverkusen. Leverkusen are looking for a new coach  after Xabi Alonso agreed to a deal  with  Real Madrid  after their manager left to take over the role as manager of  Brazil .

title: Why the Colorado Rockies are every bookmaker's nightmare
content: the Colorado Rockies have the worst 50-game start in the majors since 1895 . a winning percentage puts them on pace to win only 26 games and lose 136 . bettors are fading the 2025 Rockies and avoiding backing them at all costs .

title: From Alcaraz to Gauff, ranking the 2025 French Open top contenders
content: top-ranked Jannik Sinner came off a three-month doping suspension . the men's side have reached a combined eight finals in Slams or 1000-level events in 2025 . aryna Sabalenka, coco Gauff and mirra Andreeva have reached the finals .

title: Siraj-Ur-Rehaman, Syed Sameer being grilled at Police Training College in Vizianagaram
content: The accused are being grilled every day, ever since they were given one week police custody, a couple of days ago

title: Apologise and sack Jangra, Congress tells PM Modi after BJP MP‚Äôs insensitive remarks on Pahalgam victims
content: ‚ÄúWhy should the silence of Prime Minister Modi and the BJP leadership not be considered a tacit approval of these statements?‚Äù Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said

title: Caste census not divisive, it will strengthen social justice: Scheduled Caste rights panel chief
content: NCSC Chairperson Kishor Makwana supports caste enumeration in census for social justice and policy decisions, rejecting division concerns

title: New law on the cards to ban basement parking in low-lying areas in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru Development Minister D.K. Shivakumar said a compensation of ‚Çπ10,000 will be given to each household affected by flooding caused due to torrential rains in several parts of the city.

title: PM Modi, Union Ministers attend NDA CMs' meet
content: Operation Sindoor, caste enumeration, the first anniversary of the Modi government in its third term and good governance issues are on the agenda of the meeting

title: Consumer panel orders power company to pay ‚Çπ10 lakh to Nagpur farmer for crop damage
content: The farmer alleged that on March 22, 2018, the trees caught fire due to friction and sparking between two wires of high-tension transmission line passing over his field and were completely burnt.

title: Pahalgam attack: BJP MP sparks row saying tourists should have fought terrorists, women lacked ‚Äòwarrior spirit‚Äô
content: The number of casualties would have been less had the tourists undergone the Agniveer training, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ram Chander Jangra said

content: PM Modi emphasised that the operation was not a one-off military action, but a reflection of a changing and resolute India

title: Byelection to Nilambur assembly constituency in Kerala on June 19
content: With the announcement of the poll date, the Model Code of Conduct has come into force in Malappuram district, as per the existing ECI guidelines

title: Kerala bypoll: Nilambur bypoll on June 23; UDF, LDF set to declare candidates
content: Nilambur Assembly constituency comprises Nilambur municipality and the panchayats of Vazhikkadavu, Moothedam, Edakkara, Pothukal, Chungathara, Karulai and Amarambalam.

title: Southwest monsoon likely to reach A.P. in next three days
content: The State has received 88.5 mm of rain against the normal of 39.2 mm between May 1 and May 21, a departure by 126% from the normal, according to IMD

title: News in Frames: Chasing the monsoon
content: The southwest monsoon brings with it bountiful rain as well as a much-needed relief from the heat of the summer; this year, it has arrived eight days earlier than usual, marking the earliest onset since 2009

title: Shashi Tharoor slams Kerala Govt for aid to Turkiye in 2023; John Brittas reminds him aid was part of Union Govt‚Äôs ‚ÄòOperation Dost‚Äô

title: Assembly bypolls to five seats in four states on June 19: Election Commission
content: While two assembly bypolls will be held in Gujarat, one each will take place in Kerala, West Bengal and Punjab. The counting of votes will take place on June 23, the poll authority said.

title: Tilted cargo ship off Kochi coast further submerges; all 24 crew members rescued
content: Both Indian ‚Å†Coast Guard and Indian Navy ships are maintaining their position in the area, monitoring the situation

title: No one sitting in Pakistan will be allowed to believe they can just kill Indian citizens with impunity: Tharoor
content: ‚ÄúWe have no desire to have anything that the Pakistanis have. Sadly, we may be a status quo power. They are not. They are a revisionist power. They covet territory that India controls, and they want to have it at any price,‚Äù Mr Tharoor said

title: Southwest monsoon to reach Maharashtra soon, conditions favourable for 2 to 3 days: IMD
content: ‚ÄúThe conditions are favourable for the advancement of the southwest monsoon, which has already reached the Kerala coast almost a week ahead of its normal onset date of June 1,‚Äù Dr Shubhangi Bhute, head of the Regional Meteorological Centre in Mumbai, said

title: Four people, including wildlife activist Radheshyam Pemani, killed in road accident in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer
content: The deceased have been identified as wildlife activist Radheshyam Pemani, Shyam Vishnoi, Kanvraj Singh and forest guard Surendra Chaudhary, police said

title: First cherry cargo train set to roll from J&K to Mumbai next month
content: The effort is a welcome initiative if goes off successfully as it will offload the road traffic burden and will enable perishable goods like cherries reach its intended markets with minimal damage

title: My FB page was hacked: Tej Pratap after viral post claims he was 'in relationship'
content: The post had drawn flak from social media users, many of whom reminded the 37-year-old politician of his marriage that took place with much fanfare in 2018

title: Delhi rains: Thunderstorm, rain give Delhi relief from heat, disrupt flights, cause waterlogging
content: The IMD issued a red alert for Delhi and nearby areas, warning of strong thunderstorms, rain, and high-speed winds over the next two to three hours

title: Railway Ministry approves new train between Agartala and Guwahati, trial run of electric locomotives completes

title: Chief Kazi to T.N. govt. Salahuddin Mohammed Ayub passes away at 84
content: In a condolence message, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin said he was deeply saddened to hear about the passing of Salahuddin Mohammed Ayub.

title: Bus incident: Manipur group announces civil disobedience
content: The Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity declared the ‚Äòpublic boycott‚Äô of Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla after the expiry of its 48-hour general strike

title: Afghans can apply for Indian visas again, including investors, artists, sportspersons
content: New online visa module for Afghans rolled out in last week of April, source says; resumption of visa services comes five years after Taliban takeover in Kabul; applicants need Afghan passport, national ID card

title: Threadbare protection against a harsh summer

content: Health Department instructs secondary and tertiary hospitals in State to keep isolation wards, oxygen cylinders, ventilators, PPE kits, etc. ready

title: Piyush Goyal meets EU counterpart for second time in a month on FTA talks
content: Mr. Goyal travelled to Brussels on May 23 from Washington, while India's chief negotiator L Satya Srinivas and his team are already at the EU headquarters for the FTA negotiations.

title: Artillery‚Äôs firepower reverberates during Operation Sindoor

title: State Highways begins counting of vehicles on key roads in Vellore

title: Nominations window open for businessline Changemaker Awards 2025
content: Nominations can be made across five categories of awards ‚Äî Changemaker: Social Transformation; Changemaker: Digital Transformation; Changemaker: Financial Transformation; Young Changemaker and Iconic Changemaker. One flagship award goes to the Changemaker of the Year which is awarded to a person or an organisation that has ushered in far-reaching change.
